channel.title: Herald-Tribune (Custom RSS - Broad Article Grab)
channel.description: A personal RSS feed with broader article scraping from heraldtribune.com

item.title: Freedom Boat Club launches new mobile app as part of digital upgrade
item.description: VENICE — The Freedom Boat Club, the world’s largest boat club and a Brunswick Corporation brand, recently announced the launch of its new mobile app, redefining how members interact with the club from reservation to water.

item.title: Fly away! Breeze adds 19 new routes, including several from Florida
item.description: Sometimes you just need to get away. Even if where you are is where others head to when they want to get away.

item.title: Open kitchen shelves may look great, Marni says, but are they for you?
item.description: I know it’s tempting. You see those clean, uncluttered open shelves in kitchens, with their matching ceramic dishes, beautifully staged glassware, lots of negative space, and you think, “Why not? If my kitchen had open shelving, my belongings would look great, too! Plus, everything would be so easy to reach.”

item.title: Marni's sentimental guide to giving the past a presence in our homes
item.description: Over the years, I have earned the reputation as the stuff police. I am forever nagging you to purge, declutter, toss, donate, edit, dump, oust, clear, lighten up and let go. But today, sit down, I am going to sentimentally suggest that some old things you should keep.

item.title: Slowest storm season start since 2009, but beware the…
item.description: A few weeks ago, Gen Z interns in collaboration with ChatGPT released a purportedlist of America’s most boring cities. Amongst other Gulf Coast locales,Tallahassee placed in the top 10,and Jacksonville — where you can quite literally take a monorail to a Quizno’s, folks — was ranked the #1 dullest city in the country.

item.title: 5 Point Equity LLC buys retail building on U.S. 41 for $7 million
item.description: 5 Point Equity LLC bought a 13,000-square-foot retail property on U.S. 41 just north of Sarasota Memorial Hospital in Sarasota for $7 million, according to a press release.

item.title: Walmart buys land to build first Venice location for $20.8 million
item.description: VENICE – Venice proper is getting its first Walmart, at the northwest corner ofTwin Laurel Boulevard and Laurel Road, just off Interstate 75.
